revised_title: The Impact of Double Refraction on Polarized Light Measurements
tldr: The author discovered a significant source of error in their polarized light measurements due to double refraction in the lenses of their spectrometer. This defect affected all their previous results, including those comparing the electromagnetic theory of light with experimental findings. The author is now seeking a lens free from this defect to repeat the experiments and plans to share the results with the Royal Society in the future.
